Class Entity

java.lang.Object
jgame.Entity
Direct Known Subclasses:
World.Edge
public abstract class Entity extends Object

  • Field Details

    • rotationMode

      public Entity.RotationMode rotationMode
      Controls how the Entity rotates.
      See Also:
      • Entity.RotationMode

    • x

      public double x
      The horizontal position of the Entity.
      Increasing values move the Entity rightwards.

    • y

      public double y
      The vertical position of the Entity.
      Increasing values move the Entity downwards.

    • rotation

      public double rotation
      The orientation of the Entity, in degrees.
      Increasing values rotate the Entity clockwise.

    • sprite

      public Sprite sprite
      The Sprite used to draw the Entity to the world.

    • shape

      public Shape shape
      The Shape of this Entity which is used for collisions, and, if no sprite is set, drawing to the World.
      This shape should be centered about the point (0,0)

    • color

      protected Color color
      The Color used to draw this Entity to the World

    • fill

      protected boolean fill
      Whether the Entity's Shape should be drawn as an outline, or a solid block

    • lineWidth

      protected int lineWidth
      If fill is false, sets the width of the line to draw. If fill is true, has no effect

    • world

      protected World world
      The World containing this Entity

  • Constructor Details

    • Entity

      public Entity()

  • Method Details

    • setup

      public abstract void setup()
      This method is called when the World first starts. Setup should include anything that needs to be done before the Entity first displays
      See Also:
      • shape
      • color
      • fill
      • lineWidth
      • x
      • y
      • rotation
      • rotationMode

    • update

      public abstract void update()
      This method is called every time the Game updates, based on it's specified framerate. All game logic, like movement or combat, should be implemented here.
      See Also:
      • Game.setFramerate(double)

    • collisionWithType

      public <T extends Entity> T collisionWithType(Class<T> type)
      Returns an Entity of the specified type which collides with this one, if one exists, else returns null.

      Example usage: If class Enemy extends Entity, a colliding Enemy could be retrieved with
      Enemy e = collisionWithType(Enemy.class)
      Type Parameters:
      T - The class to check for collisions with. Must be a subclass of Entity.
      Parameters:
      type - The class to check for a collision with. Must be a subclass of Entity.
      Returns:
      An Entity which overlaps this one, or null if there are none.

    • collisionsWithType

      public <T extends Entity> List<T> collisionsWithType(Class<T> type)
      Returns a List of all Entities of the specified type which collide with this one.

      Example usage: If class Enemy extends Entity, all colliding Enemies could be retrieved with
      Enemy e = collisionsWithType(Enemy.class)
      Type Parameters:
      T - The class to check for collisions with. Must be a subclass of Entity.
      Parameters:
      type - The class to check for a collision with. Must be a subclass of Entity.
      Returns:
      An List containing all Entities which overlap this one

    • collidesWith

      public boolean collidesWith(Entity other)
      Returns whether this Entity and the specified Entity are colliding, i.e. whether their shapes overlap.
      Parameters:
      other - The entity to check for collision with
      Returns:
      Whether this entity and other are colliding.

    • directionTo

      public double directionTo(Entity other)
      Returns the direction, in degrees, toward the specified Entity
      Parameters:
      other - The Entity to get the direction toward
      Returns:
      The direction toward that Entity

    • directionTo

      public double directionTo(Point point)
      Returns the direction, in degrees, toward the specified Point
      Parameters:
      point - The Point to get the direction toward
      Returns:
      The direction toward that point

    • distanceTo

      public double distanceTo(Entity other)
      Returns the distance, from center to center, between this Entity and the specified Entity
      Parameters:
      other - The Entity to check against
      Returns:
      The distance to that Entity

    • distanceTo

      public double distanceTo(Point point)
      Returns the distance from the center of this Entity and the specified Point
      Parameters:
      point - The Point to check against
      Returns:
      The distance to that Point

    • getTransform

      protected final AffineTransform getTransform()
      Returns the AffineTransform representing this Entity's position in the World, including its position and rotation, depending on the rotation mode of the entity
      Returns:
      This Entity's transform

    • getCollisionArea

      public final Area getCollisionArea()
      Returns the Area describing this Entity's Shape, transformed to the correct position and orientation of the Entity
      Returns:
      This Entity's Area

    • getShape

      public Shape getShape()

    • rawPaint

      public void rawPaint(Graphics g)
      Applies the appropriate transform to the passed Graphics object, then passed it to paint(Graphics).

      Override this method if you want to control whether to respect the Entity's position, otherwise override paint(Graphics)
      Parameters:
      g - The untransformed graphics to draw on

    • paint

      public void paint(Graphics g)
      Draws the Entity to the given Graphics object. This Graphics will already have the appropriate transformations applied, based on this Entity's x, y, rotation, and rotationMode

      Overriding this method is the preferred way to change how an Entity draws.
      Parameters:
      g - The transformed graphics to draw on

    • getRadians

      public double getRadians()
      Returns the rotation of this Entity, converted to radians for easier use with trigonometric functions and transformations.
      Returns:
      this Entity's rotation, in radians
